answers.answer: If you were having tests to detect gestational diabetes since you were pregnant, and at 30 weeks you are having raised blood sugars, you needn't worry and have a plan set out with your doctor, usually requiring a regular monitoring of blood glucose at morning before breakfast and after meals,treatment would be generally by insulin injection,also keep a watch on the high and low numbers of blood glucose in a journal along with blood pressure values.wishing you a safe pregnancy and healthy babyregards

question: I just found out I gestational diabetes... I am 30 weeks... and worried... the nurse just told me not to eat added sugar... but finding out so late... will it have added effects to me and my child... I am starving to do as told... but has the harm already been down and if so... what are the effects... would really like to know more...
title: gestational diabetes....
